  "Broker Comment" : "UPON MY TERMINATION FROM AMERIPRISE FINANCIAL SERVICES, ON JUNE 27, 2003, I ENTERED INTO A COMPANY AUTHORIZED BUY-SELL AGREEMENT WITH AN AMERIPRISE FINANCIAL ADVISOR.  THE BUY-SELL AGREEMENT STATES THAT THE AMERIPRISE FINANCIAL ADVISOR PURCHASED THE RIGHT TO RECEIVE COMMISSIONS ON MY CUSTOMERS' ACCOUNTS AND IT STATES THAT THE FINANCIAL ADVISOR HAS THE RESPONSIBILITY TO SERVICE ALL MY CUSTOMERS.  IF THE ADVISOR PROPERLY SERVICED THE CUSTOMER'S ACCOUNT, SHE MAY HAVE BEEN MORE SATISFIED WITH HER INSURANCE PRODUCT AND SHE MAY NOT HAVE FILED A COMPLAINT."
}

{
  "Allegations" : "CUSTOMER ALLEGES SHE WAS SOLD AN UNSUITABLE VARIABLE ANNUITY WHICH CAUSED ADVERSE TAX CONSEQUENCES.",
  "Damage Amount Requested" : "$40,000.00",
  "Settlement Amount" : "$35,000.00",
  "DisplayAAOLinkIfExists" : "Y",
  "arbitrationClaimFiledDetail" : "08-01643",
  "arbitrationDocketNumber" : "",
  "Broker Comment" : "THE CUSTOMER SOLD PUBLIX STOCK THAT WAS HELD IN AN ESOP PLAN THAT WAS DISTRIBUTED TO THE CUSTOMER UPON HER RETIREMENT FROM PUBLIX SUPERMARKETS. THE STOCK SALE PROCEEDS WERE INVESTED IN A PRUDENTIAL VARIABLE ANNUITY ON A DATE THAT WAS BEYOND THE 60 DAY ROLLOVER PERIOD FOR A TAX QUALIFIED ROLLOVER. CONSEQUENTLY, THE CUSTOMER INCURRED FEDERAL INCOME TAX ON THE SALE OF THE STOCK. THE PRUDENTIAL VARIABLE ANNUITY WAS ISSUED CORRECTLY AS A NON-QUALIFIED PLAN. THE PRUDENTIAL VARIABLE ANNUITY WAS ISSUED CORRECTLY AS A NON-QUALIFIED PLAN. THE PRUDENTIAL VARIABLE ANNUITY INCLUDED A PRINCIPAL GUARANTEE AFTER 7 YEARS AND A MODERATE RISK DIVERSIFIED MANAGED PORTFOLIO. THE COMPLAINT WAS SETTLED AT FINRA BY MEDIATION. THE E&O INSURANCE CARRIER, FIREMAN'S FUND, PAID A SETTLEMENT OF $30,000 AND ALLSTATE PAID $5,000. NO DISCIPLINARY ACTION WAS TAKEN BY FINRA TOWARD ME."
}

  "Allegations" : "THE CLIENT, WHO HAPPENS TO BE MY EX-WIFE, ALLEGED THAT I FAILED TO DISCLOSE THE SURRENDER CHARGES ON ANNUITIES AND MUTUAL FUNDS I SOLD HER.
